00049 syx_int32 _syx_memory_size;
00050 SyxObject *syx_memory;
00051 SyxOop *_syx_freed_memory;
00052 syx_int32 _syx_freed_memory_top;
00053 
00054 static syx_bool _syx_memory_initialized = FALSE;
00055 
00056 #define SYX_MEMORY_TOP (&syx_memory[_syx_memory_size - 1])
00057 
00058 typedef enum
00059 {
00060   SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_IMMEDIATE,
00061   SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_OBJECT,
00062   SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_FRAME_POINTER,
00063 
00064   SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_NORMAL,
00065   SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_LARGE_INTEGER,
00066   
00067   SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_BOF, /* Beginning of frame */
00068   SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_EOS  /* End of stack */
00069 } SyxMemoryType;
00070 
00071 typedef struct SyxMemoryLazyPointer SyxMemoryLazyPointer;
00072 struct SyxMemoryLazyPointer
00073 {
00074   SyxOop stack;
00075   syx_int32 offset;
00076   SyxOop *entry;
00077 };
00078 
00079 /* Lazy pointers to be fixed once the image is loaded */
00080 static SyxMemoryLazyPointer *_syx_memory_lazy_pointers = NULL;
00081 static syx_int32 _syx_memory_lazy_pointers_top = 0;
00082 
00083 /* Holds temporary objects that must not be freed during a transaction */
00084 SyxOop _syx_memory_gc_trans[0x100];
00085 syx_int32 _syx_memory_gc_trans_top = 0;
00086 syx_int32 _syx_memory_gc_trans_running = 0;
00087 
00088 void _syx_interp_save_process_state (SyxInterpState *state);
00089 static syx_bool _syx_memory_read_process_stack (SyxOop *oop, FILE *image);
00090 static syx_bool _syx_memory_read (SyxOop *oops, syx_bool mark_type, syx_varsize n, FILE *image);

00108 void
00109 syx_memory_init (syx_int32 mem_size)
00110 {
00111   SyxObject *object;
00112 
00113   if (_syx_memory_initialized)
00114     {
00115       if (mem_size > _syx_memory_size)
00116         {
00117           syx_realloc (syx_memory, sizeof (SyxObject) * mem_size);
00118           syx_realloc (_syx_freed_memory, sizeof (SyxOop) * mem_size);
00119         }
00120 
00121       return;
00122     }
00123 
00124   _syx_memory_size = mem_size;
00125 
00126   syx_memory = (SyxObject *) syx_calloc (_syx_memory_size, sizeof (SyxObject));
00127   _syx_freed_memory = (SyxOop *) syx_calloc (_syx_memory_size, sizeof (SyxOop));
00128 
00129   /* fill freed memory with all memory oops */
00130   for (_syx_freed_memory_top=0, object=SYX_MEMORY_TOP;
00131        _syx_freed_memory_top < _syx_memory_size;
00132        _syx_freed_memory_top++, object--)
00133     _syx_freed_memory[_syx_freed_memory_top] = (SyxOop) object;
00134   _syx_memory_gc_trans_running = 0;
00135   _syx_memory_gc_trans_top = 0;
00136 
00137   _syx_memory_initialized = TRUE;
00138 }
00139 
00141 void
00142 syx_memory_clear (void)
00143 {
00144   SyxObject *object = syx_memory;
00145   SyxOop context, process;
00146 
00147   if (!_syx_memory_initialized)
00148     return;
00149 
00150   object = syx_memory;
00151 
00152   /* finalize objects */
00153   for (object=syx_memory; object <= SYX_MEMORY_TOP; object++)
00154     {
00155       if (SYX_IS_NIL (object->klass))
00156         continue;
00157 
00158       if (SYX_IS_TRUE (SYX_CLASS_FINALIZATION (object->klass)))
00159         {
00160           process = syx_process_new ();
00161           context = syx_send_unary_message (SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (object), "finalize");
00162           syx_interp_enter_context (process, context);
00163           syx_process_execute_blocking (process);
00164         }
00165     }
00166 
00167   /* free memory used by objects */
00168   for (object=syx_memory; object <= SYX_MEMORY_TOP; object++)
00169     {
00170       if (object->vars)
00171         syx_free (object->vars);
00172       if (object->data)
00173         syx_free (object->data);
00174     }
00175 
00176   syx_free (syx_memory);
00177   syx_free (_syx_freed_memory);
00178   _syx_memory_initialized = FALSE;
00179 }
00180 
00182 SyxOop
00183 syx_memory_alloc (void)
00184 {
00185   SyxOop oop;
00186 
00187   if (_syx_freed_memory_top == 0)
00188     {
00189       syx_memory_gc ();
00190       if (_syx_freed_memory_top == 0)
00191         syx_error ("object memory heap is really full\n");
00192     }
00193 
00194   oop = _syx_freed_memory[--_syx_freed_memory_top];
00195 
00196   /* Prevent the object from being collected */
00197   if (_syx_memory_gc_trans_running)
00198     {
00199       if (_syx_memory_gc_trans_top == 0x100)
00200         syx_error ("transactions can hold up to 256 objects\n");
00201 
00202       SYX_OBJECT_IS_MARKED(oop) = TRUE;
00203       _syx_memory_gc_trans[_syx_memory_gc_trans_top++] = oop;
00204     }
00205   else
00206     SYX_OBJECT_IS_MARKED(oop) = FALSE;
00207 
00208   return oop;
00209 }
00210 
00211 
00212 
00213 INLINE void
00214 _syx_memory_gc_mark (SyxOop object)
00215 {
00216   syx_varsize i;
00217 
00218   if (!SYX_IS_OBJECT (object) || SYX_OBJECT_IS_MARKED(object) || SYX_IS_NIL(syx_object_get_class (object)))
00219     return;
00220 
00221   SYX_OBJECT_IS_MARKED(object) = TRUE;
00222 
00223   _syx_memory_gc_mark (SYX_OBJECT(object)->klass);
00224 
00225   /* Only the used stack part of the process must be marked */
00226   if (SYX_OOP_EQ (syx_object_get_class (object), syx_process_class))
00227     {
00228       SyxOop stack = SYX_PROCESS_STACK (object);
00229       SyxInterpFrame *frame = SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (SYX_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER (object));
00230       syx_int32 offset = SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (frame->stack,
00231                                               SYX_OBJECT_DATA (stack));
00232 
00233       SYX_OBJECT_IS_MARKED(stack) = TRUE;
00234 
00235       /* First mark variables except the process stack */
00236       for (i=0; i < SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK; i++)
00237         _syx_memory_gc_mark (SYX_OBJECT_VARS(object)[i]);
00238 
00239       /* Mark detached frames */
00240       while (frame)
00241         {
00242           _syx_memory_gc_mark (frame->detached_frame);
00243           frame = frame->parent_frame;
00244         }
00245 
00246       /* Now mark the stack */
00247       for (i=0; i < offset; i++)
00248         _syx_memory_gc_mark (SYX_OBJECT_DATA(stack)[i]);
00249 
00250       /* Mark variables after the process stack */
00251       for (i=SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK+1; i < syx_object_vars_size (object); i++)
00252         _syx_memory_gc_mark (SYX_OBJECT_VARS(object)[i]);
00253 
00254       /* Process has no data */
00255       return;
00256     }
00257   else
00258     {
00259       for (i=0; i < syx_object_vars_size (object); i++)
00260         _syx_memory_gc_mark (SYX_OBJECT_VARS(object)[i]);
00261     }
00262 
00263   if (SYX_OBJECT_HAS_REFS (object))
00264     {
00265       for (i=0; i < SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (object); i++)
00266         _syx_memory_gc_mark (SYX_OBJECT_DATA(object)[i]);
00267     }
00268 }
00269 
00270 /* Walk trough the memory and collect unmarked objects */
00271 static void
00272 _syx_memory_gc_sweep ()
00273 {
00274   SyxObject *object;
00275 
00276   /* skip constants */
00277   syx_memory[0].is_marked = FALSE;
00278   syx_memory[1].is_marked = FALSE;
00279   syx_memory[2].is_marked = FALSE;
00280 
00281   for (object=syx_memory+3; object <= SYX_MEMORY_TOP; object++)
00282     {
00283       if (SYX_IS_NIL (object->klass))
00284         continue;
00285 
00286       if (object->is_marked)
00287         object->is_marked = FALSE;
00288       else
00289         syx_object_free ((SyxOop) object);
00290     }
00291 }
00292 
00294 void
00295 syx_memory_gc (void)
00296 {
00297 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_GC
00298   syx_int32 old_top = _syx_freed_memory_top;
00299   syx_int32 reclaimed;
00300 #endif
00301 
00302   /* Save the state of transactions.
00303      syx_object_free can call #finalize methods, so we need another transaction */
00304   syx_int32 trans_top = _syx_memory_gc_trans_top;
00305   syx_int32 trans_running = _syx_memory_gc_trans_running;
00306   SyxOop trans[0x100];
00307   memcpy (trans, _syx_memory_gc_trans, sizeof (SyxOop) * 0x100);
00308   _syx_memory_gc_trans_top = 0;
00309   _syx_memory_gc_trans_running = 0;
00310 
00311   /* Save the active process state to make sure we mark the current frame */
00312   _syx_interp_save_process_state (&_syx_interp_state);
00313 
00314   _syx_memory_gc_mark (syx_symbols);
00315   _syx_memory_gc_mark (syx_globals);
00316   _syx_memory_gc_sweep ();
00317 
00318 #ifdef SYX_DEBUG_GC
00319   reclaimed = _syx_freed_memory_top - old_top;
00320   syx_debug ("GC: reclaimed %d (%d%%); available %d; used %d; total %d\n", reclaimed, reclaimed * 100 / _syx_memory_size, _syx_freed_memory_top, _syx_memory_size - _syx_freed_memory_top, _syx_memory_size);
00321 #endif
00322 
00323   /* Restore the normal transaction */
00324   _syx_memory_gc_trans_top = trans_top;
00325   _syx_memory_gc_trans_running = trans_running;
00326   memcpy (_syx_memory_gc_trans, trans, sizeof (SyxOop) * 0x100);
00327 }
00328 
00329 
00330 static void
00331 _syx_memory_write (SyxOop *oops, syx_bool mark_type, syx_varsize n, FILE *image)
00332 {
00333   syx_int32 i, idx;
00334   SyxOop oop;
00335   for (i=0; i < n; i++)
00336     {
00337       oop = oops[i];
00338       if (SYX_IS_OBJECT (oop))
00339         {
00340           if (mark_type)
00341             fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_OBJECT, image);
00342 
00343           idx = SYX_MEMORY_INDEX_OF (oop);
00344           idx = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (idx);
00345           fwrite (&idx, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00346         }
00347       else if (SYX_IS_CPOINTER (oop))
00348         {
00349           /* Write nil for C pointers, they must not be available when starting again the interpreter */
00350           if (mark_type)
00351             fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_IMMEDIATE, image);
00352 
00353           idx = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (0);
00354           fwrite (&idx, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00355         }
00356       else
00357         {
00358           if (mark_type)
00359             fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_IMMEDIATE, image);
00360 
00361           idx = (syx_int32)oop;
00362           idx = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (idx);
00363           fwrite (&idx, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00364         }
00365     }
00366 }
00367 
00368 
00369 /* Write the variables of a Process or of a Context, fixing the frame pointer to match a valid index
00370    in the stack */
00371 static void
00372 _syx_memory_write_vars_with_fp (SyxObject *object, SyxVariables stack_var, SyxVariables fp_var, FILE *image)
00373 {
00374   SyxInterpFrame *frame = SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (object->vars[fp_var]);
00375   SyxOop stack;
00376   syx_int32 offset;
00377 
00378   if (!SYX_IS_NIL (frame->detached_frame))
00379     {
00380       stack = frame->detached_frame;
00381       offset = 0;
00382     }
00383   else
00384     {
00385       stack = object->vars[stack_var];
00386       offset = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (frame, SYX_OBJECT_DATA (stack)));
00387     }
00388 
00389   /* Write all variables before FRAME_POINTER */
00390   _syx_memory_write (object->vars, TRUE, fp_var, image);
00391   /* Now specify our own type for frame pointers */
00392   fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_FRAME_POINTER, image);
00393   /* We have to store the stack OOP in order to point to the right stack when loading back the image */
00394   _syx_memory_write (&stack, FALSE, 1, image);
00395   fwrite (&offset, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00396   /* Let's store the remaining variables */
00397   _syx_memory_write (object->vars + fp_var + 1, TRUE,
00398                      syx_object_vars_size ((SyxOop)object) - fp_var - 1, image);
00399 }
00400 
00401 /* Dump the header of the object with variables */
00402 static void
00403 _syx_memory_write_object_with_vars (SyxObject *object, FILE *image)
00404 {
00405   syx_int32 data;
00406 
00407   _syx_memory_write ((SyxOop *)&object, FALSE, 1, image);
00408   _syx_memory_write (&object->klass, FALSE, 1, image);
00409   fputc (object->has_refs, image);
00410   fputc (object->is_constant, image);
00411 
00412   data = syx_object_vars_size ((SyxOop)object);
00413   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32(data);
00414   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00415 
00416   /* store instance variables, keep an eye on special cases */
00417   if ((SYX_OOP_EQ (object->klass, syx_block_context_class) ||
00418        SYX_OOP_EQ (object->klass, syx_method_context_class))
00419       && !SYX_IS_NIL (object->vars[SYX_VARS_CONTEXT_PART_STACK]))
00420     _syx_memory_write_vars_with_fp (object, SYX_VARS_CONTEXT_PART_STACK, SYX_VARS_CONTEXT_PART_FRAME_POINTER, image);
00421   else if (SYX_OOP_EQ (object->klass, syx_process_class)
00422            && !SYX_IS_NIL (object->vars[SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK]))
00423     _syx_memory_write_vars_with_fp (object, SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK, SYX_VARS_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER, image);
00424   else
00425     _syx_memory_write (object->vars, TRUE, SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32(data), image);
00426 }
00427 
00428 /* Writes a single entry of the frame that points to another frame */
00429 static void
00430 _syx_memory_write_lazy_pointer (SyxObject *process, SyxInterpFrame *frame, FILE *image)
00431 {
00432   SyxOop stack;
00433   syx_int32 offset;
00434   if (frame && !SYX_IS_NIL (frame->detached_frame))
00435     stack = frame->detached_frame;
00436   else if (!process || !frame)
00437     stack = syx_nil; /* this will be encoded as 0 */
00438   else
00439     stack = process->vars[SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK];
00440 
00441   _syx_memory_write (&stack, FALSE, 1, image);
00442   offset = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (frame, SYX_OBJECT_DATA (stack)));
00443 
00444   fwrite (&offset, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00445 }
00446 
00447 /* Dump a single frame */
00448 static void
00449 _syx_memory_write_frame (SyxObject *process, SyxInterpFrame *frame, SyxInterpFrame *upper_frame, FILE *image)
00450 {
00451   syx_int32 data;
00452   SyxInterpFrame *bottom_frame;
00453 
00454   if (!process)
00455     bottom_frame = NULL;
00456   else
00457     bottom_frame = (SyxInterpFrame *)SYX_OBJECT_DATA (process->vars[SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK]);
00458 
00459   _syx_memory_write (&frame->this_context, FALSE, 1, image);
00460   _syx_memory_write (&frame->detached_frame, FALSE, 1, image);
00461   _syx_memory_write_lazy_pointer (process, frame->parent_frame, image);
00462   _syx_memory_write_lazy_pointer (process, frame->outer_frame, image);
00463   _syx_memory_write_lazy_pointer (process, frame->stack_return_frame, image);
00464   _syx_memory_write (&frame->method, FALSE, 1, image);
00465   _syx_memory_write (&frame->closure, FALSE, 1, image);
00466   /* this is not a SmallInteger */
00467   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (frame->next_instruction);
00468   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00469   /* the stack pointer should point inside the process stack itself */
00470   if (process)
00471     _syx_memory_write (&process->vars[SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK], FALSE, 1, image);
00472   else
00473     {
00474       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (0);
00475       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00476     }
00477   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (frame->stack, bottom_frame));
00478   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00479   _syx_memory_write (&frame->receiver, TRUE, 1, image);
00480   /* Store arguments, temporaries and local stack.
00481      Only copy arguments and temporaries for detached frames without following the stack pointer */
00482   if (SYX_IS_NIL (frame->detached_frame))
00483     {
00484       /* if no upper_frame is given, this frame is the top most frame of the process stack */
00485       if (!upper_frame)
00486         data = SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (frame->stack, &frame->local);
00487       else
00488         data = SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (upper_frame, &frame->local);
00489     }
00490   else
00491     data = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (frame->detached_frame) - SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (&frame->local, frame);
00492   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00493   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00494   _syx_memory_write (&frame->local, TRUE, SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data), image);
00495 }
00496 
00497 /* Dump the whole stack of the process.
00498    This will also dump relative objects containing stack, like block closure outerFrames. */
00499 static void
00500 _syx_memory_write_process_stack (SyxObject *process, FILE *image)
00501 {
00502   syx_int32 data;
00503   SyxObject *stack = SYX_OBJECT (process->vars[SYX_VARS_PROCESS_STACK]);
00504   SyxInterpFrame *bottom_frame = (SyxInterpFrame *)stack->data;
00505   SyxInterpFrame *frame = SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (process->vars[SYX_VARS_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER]);
00506   SyxInterpFrame *upper_frame = NULL;
00507   SyxOop *oop;
00508 
00509   if (SYX_IS_NIL (SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (stack)))
00510     return;
00511 
00512   _syx_memory_write_object_with_vars (stack, image);
00513 
00514   /* store data size */
00515   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (stack->data_size);
00516   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00517   /* We have to do things in reverse order because the stack is such a reverse single linked list,
00518      each frame connected by parent frames */
00519   while (frame)
00520     {
00521       /* We store detached frames later */
00522       if (!SYX_IS_NIL (frame->detached_frame))
00523         {
00524           frame = frame->parent_frame;
00525           continue;
00526         }
00527 
00528       /* Store the index of this frame */
00529       fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_BOF, image);
00530       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (frame, bottom_frame));
00531       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00532       _syx_memory_write_frame (process, frame, NULL, image);
00533       upper_frame = frame;
00534       frame = frame->parent_frame;
00535     }
00536   fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_EOS, image);
00537   /* We have to store the rest of objects, for detached frames, up to the upper frame.
00538      What we need is only the local stacks, but we don't know where they begin, so just skip C pointers */
00539   if (upper_frame)
00540     {
00541       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET (upper_frame, bottom_frame));
00542       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00543       for (oop = (SyxOop *)bottom_frame; oop != (SyxOop *)upper_frame; oop++)
00544         {
00545           if (SYX_IS_CPOINTER (*oop))
00546             _syx_memory_write (&syx_nil, TRUE, 1, image);
00547           else
00548             _syx_memory_write (oop, TRUE, 1, image);
00549         }
00550     }
00551   else
00552     {
00553       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (0);
00554       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00555     }
00556   stack->is_marked = TRUE;
00557 
00558   /* Let's store all detached frames until they have a reference to this process */
00559   frame = SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (process->vars[SYX_VARS_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER]);
00560   while (frame)
00561     {
00562       stack = SYX_OBJECT (frame->detached_frame);
00563       /* Also check if the stack has been collected */
00564       if (SYX_IS_NIL (SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (stack)) || stack->is_marked)
00565         {
00566           frame = frame->parent_frame;
00567           continue;
00568         }
00569 
00570       _syx_memory_write_object_with_vars (stack, image);
00571 
00572       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (stack->data_size);
00573       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);    
00574       /* Store the index of this frame */
00575       fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_BOF, image);
00576       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (0);
00577       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00578       _syx_memory_write_frame (process, frame, NULL, image);
00579       fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_EOS, image);
00580       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00581 
00582       stack->is_marked = TRUE;
00583       frame = frame->parent_frame;
00584     }
00585 }
00586 
00593 syx_bool
00594 syx_memory_save_image (syx_symbol path)
00595 {
00596   SyxObject *object;
00597   FILE *image;
00598   syx_int32 data = 0;
00599   SyxObject *stack;
00600   SyxOop process;
00601 
00602   if (!path)
00603     path = SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (syx_globals_at ("ImageFileName"));
00604 
00605   if (!path)
00606     return FALSE;
00607 
00608   image = fopen (path, "wb");
00609   if (!image)
00610     return FALSE;
00611 
00612   syx_memory_gc ();
00613 
00614   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (_syx_memory_size);
00615   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00616   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (_syx_freed_memory_top);
00617   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00618   _syx_memory_write (_syx_freed_memory, FALSE, _syx_freed_memory_top, image);
00619 
00620   _syx_scheduler_save (image);
00621 
00622   _syx_memory_write (&syx_globals, FALSE, 1, image);
00623   _syx_memory_write (&syx_symbols, FALSE, 1, image);
00624 
00625   /* First store the processes */
00626   process = syx_processor_active_process;
00627   if (!SYX_IS_NIL (process))
00628     {
00629       do
00630         {
00631           _syx_memory_write_process_stack (SYX_OBJECT (process), image);
00632           process = SYX_PROCESS_NEXT (process);
00633         } while (SYX_OOP_NE (process, syx_processor_active_process));
00634     }
00635 
00636   for (object=syx_memory; object <= SYX_MEMORY_TOP; object++)
00637     {
00638       /* the mark check is not related to the GC but means the object has been already written */
00639       if (SYX_IS_NIL (object->klass) || object->is_marked)
00640         continue;
00641 
00642       _syx_memory_write_object_with_vars (object, image);
00643 
00644       /* store data */
00645       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (object->data_size);
00646       fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00647       if (object->data_size > 0)
00648         {
00649           if (object->has_refs)
00650             _syx_memory_write (object->data, TRUE, object->data_size, image);
00651           else
00652             {
00653 #ifdef HAVE_LIBGMP
00654               if (SYX_OBJECT_IS_LARGE_INTEGER ((SyxOop)object))
00655                 {
00656                   /* This algorithm is used to store large integers.
00657                      We need to specify how many bytes GMP wrote to the image,
00658                      for systems that don't support GMP */
00659 
00660                   syx_int32 offset = 0;
00661                   syx_nint start, end;
00662                   /* specify that's a large integer */
00663                   fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_LARGE_INTEGER, image);
00664                   /* make space to hold the offset */
00665                   fwrite (&offset, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00666                   start = ftell (image);
00667                   mpz_out_raw (image, SYX_OBJECT_LARGE_INTEGER ((SyxOop)object));
00668                   end = ftell (image);
00669                   offset = end - start;
00670                   /* go back to the offset */
00671                   fseek (image, - offset - sizeof (syx_int32), SEEK_CUR);
00672                   /* now write the length of the data written by mpz_out_raw () */
00673                   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (offset);
00674                   fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00675                   /* return again to continue normal writing */
00676                   fseek (image, offset, SEEK_CUR);
00677                 }
00678               else
00679 #endif /* HAVE_LIBGMP */
00680                 {
00681                   /* it's not a large integer */
00682                   fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_NORMAL, image);
00683                   fwrite (object->data, sizeof (syx_int8), object->data_size, image);
00684                 }
00685             }
00686         }
00687 
00688       /* Check for block closures that are not attached to any process */
00689       if (SYX_OOP_EQ (object->klass, syx_block_closure_class))
00690         {
00691           stack = SYX_OBJECT (object->vars[SYX_VARS_BLOCK_CLOSURE_OUTER_FRAME]);
00692           /* Check if the stack has been collected or written to the image */
00693           if (SYX_IS_NIL (SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (stack)) || stack->is_marked)
00694             continue;
00695 
00696           _syx_memory_write_object_with_vars (stack, image);
00697 
00698           data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (stack->data_size);
00699           fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00700           /* Store the index of this frame */
00701           fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_BOF, image);
00702           data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (0);
00703           fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00704           /* Outer frames have only one frame */
00705           _syx_memory_write_frame (NULL, (SyxInterpFrame *)stack->data, NULL, image);
00706           fputc (SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_EOS, image);
00707           fwrite (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00708           
00709           stack->is_marked = TRUE;
00710         }
00711     }
00712 
00713   fclose (image);
00714 
00715   /* be sure all objects are unmarked */
00716   for (object=syx_memory; object <= SYX_MEMORY_TOP; object++)
00717     object->is_marked = FALSE;
00718 
00719   return TRUE;
00720 }
00721 
00722 static void
00723 _syx_memory_read_lazy_pointer (SyxOop *entry, FILE *image)
00724 {
00725   SyxMemoryLazyPointer *lazy;
00726   syx_int32 data;
00727   _syx_memory_lazy_pointers = syx_realloc (_syx_memory_lazy_pointers,
00728                                            ++_syx_memory_lazy_pointers_top * sizeof (SyxMemoryLazyPointer));
00729   lazy = &_syx_memory_lazy_pointers[_syx_memory_lazy_pointers_top - 1];
00730   
00731   /* Store the stack oop */
00732   fread(&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00733   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00734   if (!data)
00735     lazy->stack = 0;
00736   else
00737     lazy->stack = (SyxOop)(syx_memory + data);
00738   
00739   /* Store the offset */
00740   fread(&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00741   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00742   lazy->offset = data;
00743 
00744   /* Save the address of the framePointer variable */
00745   lazy->entry = entry;
00746 }
00747 
00748 static syx_bool
00749 _syx_memory_read (SyxOop *oops, syx_bool mark_type, syx_varsize n, FILE *image)
00750 {
00751   syx_int32 i, idx;
00752   SyxOop oop;
00753   SyxMemoryType type = SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_OBJECT;
00754 
00755   for (i=0; i < n; i++)
00756     {
00757       oop = 0;
00758       
00759       if (mark_type)
00760         type = fgetc (image);
00761       
00762       switch (type)
00763         {
00764         case SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_OBJECT:
00765           if (!fread (&idx, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image))
00766             return FALSE;
00767 
00768           idx = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (idx);
00769           oop = (SyxOop)(syx_memory + idx);
00770           break;
00771         case SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_IMMEDIATE:
00772           if (!fread (&idx, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image))
00773             return FALSE;
00774 
00775           oop = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (idx);
00776           break;
00777         case SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_FRAME_POINTER:
00778           _syx_memory_read_lazy_pointer (&oops[i], image);
00779           break;
00780         case SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_BOF:
00781           if (!_syx_memory_read_process_stack (&oops[i], image))
00782             return FALSE;
00783 
00784           if (!fread (&idx, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image))
00785             return FALSE;
00786           idx = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (idx);
00787           return _syx_memory_read (oops, TRUE, idx, image);
00788         default:
00789           return FALSE;
00790         }
00791 
00792       oops[i] = oop;
00793     }  
00794 
00795   return TRUE;
00796 }
00797 
00798 static syx_bool
00799 _syx_memory_read_process_stack (SyxOop *oop, FILE *image)
00800 {
00801   syx_varsize i;
00802   syx_int32 data;
00803   SyxOop *frame;
00804 
00805   do
00806     {
00807       i = 0;
00808       if (!fread (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image)) 
00809         return FALSE;
00810 
00811       frame = oop + SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00812       _syx_memory_read (frame+i++, FALSE, 1, image); /* this context */
00813       _syx_memory_read (frame+i++, FALSE, 1, image); /* detached frame */
00814       _syx_memory_read_lazy_pointer (frame+i++, image); /* parent frame */
00815       _syx_memory_read_lazy_pointer (frame+i++, image); /* outer frame */
00816       _syx_memory_read_lazy_pointer (frame+i++, image); /* stack return frame */
00817       _syx_memory_read (frame+i++, FALSE, 1, image); /* method */
00818       _syx_memory_read (frame+i++, FALSE, 1, image); /* closure */
00819       if (!fread (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image))
00820         return FALSE;
00821       frame[i++] = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data); /* next instruction */
00822       _syx_memory_read_lazy_pointer (frame+i++, image); /* stack pointer */
00823       _syx_memory_read (frame+i++, TRUE, 1, image); /* receiver */
00824       if (!fread (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image))
00825         return FALSE;
00826       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00827       _syx_memory_read (frame+i, TRUE, data, image); /* arguments, temporaries and local stack */
00828     } while (fgetc (image) != SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_EOS);
00829 
00830   return TRUE;
00831 }
00832 
00839 syx_bool
00840 syx_memory_load_image (syx_symbol path)
00841 {
00842   SyxObject *object;
00843   FILE *image;
00844   syx_int32 data;
00845   syx_int32 i;
00846   SyxMemoryLazyPointer *lazy;
00847   
00848   SYX_START_PROFILE;
00849 
00850   if (!path)
00851     {
00852       if (SYX_IS_NIL (syx_globals))
00853         path = syx_get_image_path ();
00854       else
00855         path = SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (syx_globals_at ("ImageFileName"));
00856     }
00857 
00858   if (!path)
00859     return FALSE;
00860 
00861   image = fopen (path, "rb");
00862   if (!image)
00863     return FALSE;
00864 
00865   fread (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00866   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00867   syx_memory_init (data);
00868 
00869   fread (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00870   _syx_freed_memory_top = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00871   _syx_memory_read (_syx_freed_memory, FALSE, _syx_freed_memory_top, image);
00872 
00873   _syx_scheduler_load (image);
00874 
00875   _syx_memory_read (&syx_globals, FALSE, 1, image);
00876   _syx_memory_read (&syx_symbols, FALSE, 1, image);
00877 
00878   while (!feof (image))
00879     {
00880       if (!_syx_memory_read ((SyxOop *)&object, FALSE, 1, image))
00881         break;
00882 
00883       _syx_memory_read (&object->klass, FALSE, 1, image);
00884       object->has_refs = fgetc (image);
00885       object->is_constant = fgetc (image);
00886 
00887       /* fetch instance variables */
00888       fread (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00889       data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00890       if (object->vars)
00891         syx_free (object->vars);
00892       object->vars = (SyxOop *) syx_calloc (data, sizeof (SyxOop));
00893       _syx_memory_read (object->vars, TRUE, data, image);
00894 
00895       /* fetch data */
00896       fread (&data, sizeof (syx_varsize), 1, image);
00897       object->data_size = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00898       if (object->data_size > 0)
00899         {
00900           if (object->data && object->data_size > 0)
00901             syx_free (object->data);
00902           
00903           if (object->has_refs)
00904             {
00905               object->data = (SyxOop *) syx_calloc (object->data_size, sizeof (SyxOop));
00906               _syx_memory_read (object->data, TRUE, object->data_size, image);
00907             }
00908           else
00909             {
00910               object->data = (SyxOop *) syx_calloc (object->data_size, sizeof (syx_int8));
00911               if (fgetc (image) == SYX_MEMORY_TYPE_LARGE_INTEGER)
00912                 {
00913                   fread (&data, sizeof (syx_int32), 1, image);
00914                   data = SYX_COMPAT_SWAP_32 (data);
00915 #ifdef HAVE_LIBGMP
00916                   mpz_init (SYX_OBJECT_LARGE_INTEGER ((SyxOop)object));
00917                   mpz_inp_raw (SYX_OBJECT_LARGE_INTEGER ((SyxOop)object), image);
00918 #else
00919                   /* skip GMP data since we can't handle it */
00920                   fseek (image, data, SEEK_CUR);
00921 #endif
00922                 }
00923               else
00924                 fread (object->data, sizeof (syx_int8), object->data_size, image);
00925             }
00926         }
00927     }
00928   
00929   fclose (image);
00930  
00931   /* Fix lazy pointers */
00932   for (i=0; i < _syx_memory_lazy_pointers_top; i++)
00933     {
00934       lazy = &_syx_memory_lazy_pointers[i];
00935       if (lazy->stack != 0)
00936         *lazy->entry = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (SYX_OBJECT_DATA (lazy->stack) + lazy->offset);
00937       else
00938         *lazy->entry = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (NULL);
00939     }
00940   syx_free (_syx_memory_lazy_pointers);
00941   _syx_memory_lazy_pointers_top = 0;
00942 
00943   syx_fetch_basic ();
00944 
00945   SYX_END_PROFILE(load_image);
00946 
00947   syx_initialize_system ();
00948 
00949   return TRUE;
00950 }
00951 
00953 void
00954 syx_memory_gc_end (void)
00955 {
00956   syx_int32 i;
00957   if (--_syx_memory_gc_trans_running > 0)
00958     return;
00959 
00960   for (i=0; i < _syx_memory_gc_trans_top; i++)
00961     SYX_OBJECT_IS_MARKED(_syx_memory_gc_trans[i]) = FALSE;
00962 
00963   _syx_memory_gc_trans_top = 0;
00964   _syx_memory_gc_trans_running = 0;
00965 }
Documented by Luca Bruno and ScaccoMatto
